content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

As a risk-averse person, I would lean towards choosing the option that provides me with more consistent earnings over time, which is B, earning 12$ per round. While there might be opportunities to earn more (45$) if both players choose R, the potential for zero earnings when the other player chooses B makes this outcome less predictable and riskier. Given that the game has 75 rounds, I believe that the consistent earnings of 12$ in each round would offer more security and certainty overall. Therefore, my choice is to play B {B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 12$. Your opponent's payoff is 12$. Please play the next round.

I would continue playing B in the next round {B}. Since both players chose B in the previous round, we both received a payout of 12$. As a risk-averse person, I prefer to stick with my choice of B because it offers me consistent earnings and maintains a steady payout regardless of what my opponent might choose. Additionally, since our strategy is already aligned (both choosing B), there's no need to deviate from that choice in the next round.
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 42$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

If my opponent chose R in the previous round, and I chose B, then I would earn a payout of 42$ while my opponent gets nothing (0$). In this case, since my opponent has already shown a preference for choosing R, I might consider adjusting my strategy to potentially increase my earnings. In order to do so, I will now choose R {R}. This decision is based on the fact that if my opponent continues with his choice of R, we both earn 45$ in the next round. However, if he changes his choice to B, I would still receive 42$, which is better than the 12$ I'd get if I continue choosing B.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 42$. Please play the next round.

If I had chosen R in the previous round, while my opponent chose B, then I would have earned nothing (0$). In this case, I would consider adjusting my strategy to maximize my earnings. Since my opponent has shown a preference for choosing B, I will now choose B {B}. This decision is based on the fact that if my opponent continues with his choice of B, we both earn 12$ in the next round. However, if I had chosen R in this round and he changes his choice to R, we would both earn 0$. By choosing B, I ensure a payout even if my opponent decides to stick with his choice of B in the next round.
